234R/A0/09/004/014.indicator_name: # (est.) affected population reached with any Child Protection intervention through cross-border assistance from Turkey in Syria / year
234R/A0/09/004/014.headline: UNICEF continued to position itself as the lead agency in coordinating and providing leadership for the CP sub-cluster as well as contribute to sub-cluster results including case management  awareness raising and  mine risk education as well as the development of an emergency preparedness and response minimum package.

234R/A0/09/004/015.indicator_name: # (est.) affected population reached with any NFI intervention through cross-border assistance from Turkey in Syria / year
234R/A0/09/004/015.headline: C4D in health played a key role in the promotion of healthy behaviors  the uptake of critical health interventions such as immunization by communities  families and care givers  and the increase in demand for health services among communities affected by the conflict in northern Syria.

234R/A0/09/004/010.indicator_name: # (est.) affected population reached with any Health intervention through cross-border assistance from Turkey in Syria / year (not including Polio immunization)
234R/A0/09/004/010.headline: UNICEF focused on reducing excess morbidity and mortality among conflict-affected population focusing on women and children through life-saving interventions and improving access to basic essential health services particularly to IDPs and those living in HTR areas. In addition to promoting uptake of essential health interventions though communication and social mobilization.

234R/A0/09/004/011.indicator_name: # (est.) affected population reached with any nutrition intervention through cross-border assistance from Turkey in Syria / year
234R/A0/09/004/011.headline: To decrease mortality and malnutrition of children U5  UNICEF supported partners to implement high impact nutrition interventions (preventive and therapeutic) especially for IDPs  including awareness on IYCF practices  treatment for severe and moderate malnutrition and the conduct of KAP and SMART surveys to enhance overall response to targeted areas.

234R/A0/09/004/012.indicator_name: # (est.) affected population reached with any WASH intervention through cross-border assistance from Turkey in Syria / year
234R/A0/09/004/012.headline: UNICEF focused on restoring the efficiency of water supply infrastructure through rehabilitation works and support sustainability of services and respond to emergency needs of displaced populations in northern Syria.

234R/A0/09/004/013.indicator_name: # (est.) affected population reached with any Education intervention through cross-border assistance from Turkey in Syria / year
234R/A0/09/004/013.headline: Quality education is critical to ensuring that Syrian children are capable of coping with the challenges of the current conflict  and Syrian population is better placed to build a just and equable society after the conflict. In 2017  UNICEF embarked on scaling-up its light education footprint.

234R/A0/08/002/001.indicator_name: % of government officials rating UNICEF-led regional emergency training programme as good or excellent
Number of national partners who have benefitted from training outreach

M&E capacity was further strengthened.
